designSystem.name: Minimalist Editorial Design System
designSystem.philosophy: A refined, literary aesthetic that emphasizes readability, breathing room, and typographic elegance. Inspired by high-end publishing and archival design with a focus on content over decoration.

primary.description: Warm off-white with subtle paper fiber texture - organic, tactile feel. Apply noise/grain overlay or paper texture at low opacity for authentic paper quality

text.description: Deep charcoal for primary text, graduated grays for hierarchy

accent.description: Vibrant coral-orange primary accent, with soft pastel supporting colors

grid.description: Very light beige grid lines, almost imperceptible

tabs.description: Pastel tab colors for categorization - yellow, pink, mint, blue

principles: Vibrant coral-orange (#FF5733) as the hero accent color - bold but refined
Soft pastel palette for UI elements and categorization
Extremely subtle grid and structural elements - barely visible
High contrast between background and primary accent
Handwritten text elements in dark gray or black
Maintain paper-like quality with warm neutral base

fontFamily.description: Classic serif typeface for elegant, literary feel

principles: Use regular weight (400) almost exclusively - avoid bold
Generous line-height for maximum readability (1.6-1.8)
Scale sizes proportionally using classic ratios
Embrace white space around text blocks
Italics for emphasis, not bold or color
Generous spacing is key - let content breathe
Use large vertical spacing between sections (3-6rem)
Consistent horizontal padding (2-3rem on containers)
Increase spacing at larger breakpoints
Create clear visual hierarchy through spacing, not decoration

grid.description: Flexible grid for varied content layouts

principles: Center align primary content
Left align body text within content areas
Asymmetric layouts acceptable for visual interest
Single column for main content, generous margins
Avoid edge-to-edge content - always provide breathing room

header.typography: Navigation size serif, understated but readable
header.alignment: Left or centered, depending on context

buttons.typography: Same as body text, possibly smaller

cards.style: Flat, no shadows or heavy borders
cards.background: Same as page or very subtle variation

images.style: Full bleed within container or generous margins

designPrinciples: Content first - design serves the content, never overwhelms it
Embrace white space as a design element
Typography is the primary design tool
Minimal decoration - no gradients, shadows, or effects
Timeless over trendy - classic editorial design
Subtle over loud - whisper, don't shout
Create hierarchy through size, spacing, and weight, not color
Respect the reader's focus and attention
Every element should serve a purpose

implementation: CSS filter: contrast(170%) brightness(1000%) with SVG noise
Background image: Seamless paper texture at 3-5% opacity
Image overlay: High-res paper scan at low opacity
paper.description: Adds organic, tactile quality without being distracting. Should feel like looking at real paper - barely perceptible but enhances the archival aesthetic

principles: Texture should be felt, not seen - extremely subtle
Maintains flat design philosophy while adding depth
Reinforces the physical, archival nature of stamps
Never interfere with text readability
Can be more pronounced on larger backgrounds, minimal on text areas

designSystem.focus: Subtle outline or underline, never heavy borders
designSystem.loading: Subtle fade-ins, no spinners unless necessary

principles: Reduce font sizes slightly on mobile, but keep readable
Reduce spacing on mobile but maintain proportions
Single column layouts on mobile
Maintain generous padding even on small screens
Increase whitespace on larger screens

accessibility.focusStates: Clear and visible without being intrusive
accessibility.textSize: Base size 18px minimum for body text
